api/api/BOOSEapp.AppArray.html.title: Class AppArray | BOOSEapp Documentation
api/api/BOOSEapp.AppArray.html.summary: Class AppArray Namespace BOOSEapp Assembly BOOSEapp.dll Represents a command that handles array creation requests, such as array int scores 10, within the BOOSE application. public class AppArray : ICommand Inheritance object AppArray Implements ICommand Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) Constructors AppArray(string) Initializes a new instance of the AppArray class using the specified array declaration command line. public AppArray(string commandLine) Parameters commandLine string The user input that describes the array declaration (for example, array int scores 10). Methods Execute(ICanvas) Executes the array declaration command by delegating the processing to the main application form. public void Execute(ICanvas canvas) Parameters canvas ICanvas The drawing canvas associated with the command execution. This parameter is not used by AppArray, but is required by the ICommand interface. ToString() Returns a human-readable description of this array declaration command. public override string ToString() Returns string A string that describes the array declaration, including the original command line text.

api/api/BOOSEapp.AppCanvas.html.title: Class AppCanvas | BOOSEapp Documentation
api/api/BOOSEapp.AppCanvas.html.summary: Class AppCanvas Namespace BOOSEapp Assembly BOOSEapp.dll Represents a drawing surface that implements the ICanvas interface. Provides methods for drawing shapes, lines, and text. public class AppCanvas : ICanvas, IDisposable Inheritance object AppCanvas Implements ICanvas IDisposable Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors AppCanvas(int, int) Initializes a new instance of the AppCanvas class with the specified dimensions. public AppCanvas(int width, int height) Parameters width int The width of the canvas in pixels. height int The height of the canvas in pixels. Exceptions CanvasException Thrown when the provided width or height is less than or equal to zero. Properties Xpos Gets the current X-coordinate of the pen. public int Xpos { get; } Property Value int Ypos Gets the current Y-coordinate of the pen. public int Ypos { get; } Property Value int Methods Circle(int, bool) Draws a circle at the current position, optionally filled. public void Circle(int radius, bool fill = false) Parameters radius int The radius of the circle. fill bool If true, fills the circle with the current brush color. Clear() Clears the canvas and resets the pen position and color to default values. public void Clear() Dispose() Releases all resources used by the AppCanvas instance. public void Dispose() DrawCircle(int) Draws a circle centered at the current position with the specified radius. public void DrawCircle(int radius) Parameters radius int The radius of the circle. Exceptions CanvasException Thrown when the radius is invalid or the circle exceeds canvas boundaries. DrawRectangle(int, int) Draws a rectangle starting from the current position with the specified dimensions. public void DrawRectangle(int width, int height) Parameters width int The width of the rectangle. height int The height of the rectangle. Exceptions CanvasException Thrown when the specified dimensions are invalid. DrawTo(int, int) Draws a straight line from the current position to the specified coordinates. public void DrawTo(int x, int y) Parameters x int The X-coordinate of the line end point. y int The Y-coordinate of the line end point. Exceptions CanvasException Thrown when the coordinates are outside the canvas bounds. GetBitmap() Returns a copy of the current canvas bitmap. public Bitmap GetBitmap() Returns Bitmap A clone of the current Bitmap representing the drawing surface. MoveTo(int, int) Moves the pen to the specified coordinates without drawing. public void MoveTo(int x, int y) Parameters x int The X-coordinate to move the pen to. y int The Y-coordinate to move the pen to. Exceptions CanvasException Thrown when the provided coordinates are outside the canvas bounds. Rect(int, int, bool) Draws a rectangle at the current position, optionally filled. public void Rect(int width, int height, bool fill = false) Parameters width int The width of the rectangle. height int The height of the rectangle. fill bool If true, fills the rectangle with the current brush color. Reset() Resets the pen position to the origin (0,0). public void Reset() SetColour(int, int, int) Sets the pen color using RGB values (alias for SetPenColor(int, int, int)). public void SetColour(int r, int g, int b) Parameters r int Red component (0–255). g int Green component (0–255). b int Blue component (0–255). SetPenColor(int, int, int) Sets the pen and brush color using RGB values. public void SetPenColor(int r, int g, int b) Parameters r int Red component (0–255). g int Green component (0–255). b int Blue component (0–255). Exceptions CanvasException Thrown when any RGB value is outside the valid range. WriteText(string) Draws the specified text at the current pen position. public void WriteText(string text) Parameters text string The text string to draw. getBitmap() Returns a copy of the current bitmap (lowercase alias for GetBitmap()). public Bitmap getBitmap() Returns Bitmap A clone of the current Bitmap.

api/api/BOOSEapp.AppCircle.html.title: Class AppCircle | BOOSEapp Documentation
api/api/BOOSEapp.AppCircle.html.summary: Class AppCircle Namespace BOOSEapp Assembly BOOSEapp.dll Represents a command that draws a circle on a canvas. public class AppCircle : ICommand Inheritance object AppCircle Implements ICommand Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) Constructors AppCircle(int) Initializes a new instance of the AppCircle class with the specified radius. public AppCircle(int radius) Parameters radius int The radius of the circle to draw. Exceptions ArgumentException Thrown when radius is less than or equal to zero. Methods Execute(ICanvas) Executes the command by drawing a circle on the specified canvas. public void Execute(ICanvas canvas) Parameters canvas ICanvas The canvas on which to draw the circle. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when canvas is null. ToString() Returns a string that represents the current circle command. public override string ToString() Returns string A string that describes the circle command, including its radius.

api/api/BOOSEapp.AppCommandFactory.html.title: Class AppCommandFactory | BOOSEapp Documentation
api/api/BOOSEapp.AppCommandFactory.html.summary: Class AppCommandFactory Namespace BOOSEapp Assembly BOOSEapp.dll Provides a singleton factory for creating ICommand instances from text input. public sealed class AppCommandFactory Inheritance object AppCommandFactory Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Properties Instance Gets the singleton instance of the AppCommandFactory. public static AppCommandFactory Instance { get; } Property Value AppCommandFactory Methods CreateCommand(string) Creates an ICommand instance from the specified command line text. public ICommand CreateCommand(string commandLine) Parameters commandLine string The textual representation of the command, including any arguments, for example: "moveto 100 200" or "circle 50". Returns ICommand An ICommand that corresponds to the parsed command text, or null if the command is not recognized or cannot be parsed. Exceptions CanvasException Thrown when an error occurs while creating the command from the specified text.

api/api/BOOSEapp.ICanvas.html.title: Interface ICanvas | BOOSEapp Documentation
api/api/BOOSEapp.ICanvas.html.summary: Interface ICanvas Namespace BOOSEapp Assembly BOOSEapp.dll Defines a contract for drawing operations on a canvas. public interface ICanvas Properties Xpos Gets the current X-coordinate of the pen. int Xpos { get; } Property Value int Ypos Gets the current Y-coordinate of the pen. int Ypos { get; } Property Value int Methods Clear() Clears the canvas and resets its drawing surface. void Clear() DrawCircle(int) Draws a circle centered at the current pen position with the specified radius. void DrawCircle(int radius) Parameters radius int The radius of the circle. DrawRectangle(int, int) Draws a rectangle starting at the current pen position with the specified dimensions. void DrawRectangle(int width, int height) Parameters width int The width of the rectangle. height int The height of the rectangle. DrawTo(int, int) Draws a line from the current pen position to the specified coordinates. void DrawTo(int x, int y) Parameters x int The destination X-coordinate. y int The destination Y-coordinate. GetBitmap() Gets a bitmap snapshot of the current canvas content. Bitmap GetBitmap() Returns Bitmap A Bitmap that represents the current canvas. MoveTo(int, int) Moves the pen to the specified coordinates without drawing. void MoveTo(int x, int y) Parameters x int The X-coordinate to move the pen to. y int The Y-coordinate to move the pen to. SetPenColor(int, int, int) Sets the pen color using RGB values. void SetPenColor(int r, int g, int b) Parameters r int The red component (0–255). g int The green component (0–255). b int The blue component (0–255). WriteText(string) Writes the specified text at the current pen position. void WriteText(string text) Parameters text string The text to write.

api/api/BOOSEapp.ICommand.html.title: Interface ICommand | BOOSEapp Documentation
api/api/BOOSEapp.ICommand.html.summary: Interface ICommand Namespace BOOSEapp Assembly BOOSEapp.dll Defines a command in the drawing program that follows the Command pattern to encapsulate a drawing operation. public interface ICommand Methods Execute(ICanvas) Executes the command on the specified canvas. void Execute(ICanvas canvas) Parameters canvas ICanvas The canvas on which to execute the command.

api/api/BOOSEapp.ICommandParser.html.summary: Interface ICommandParser Namespace BOOSEapp Assembly BOOSEapp.dll Defines a contract for parsing textual commands into executable command objects. public interface ICommandParser Methods ParseCommands(string[]) Parses an array of command strings into a list of ICommand instances. List<ICommand> ParseCommands(string[] commands) Parameters commands string[] An array of command strings to parse. Returns List<ICommand> A list of parsed ICommand objects.

MarshalByRefObject.InitializeLifetimeService() MarshalByRefObject.MemberwiseClone(bool) object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) Constructors MainForm() Initializes a new instance of the MainForm class, sets up the drawing canvas, and displays initial library information. public MainForm() Methods AppendOutput(string) Appends the specified text to the output text box, marshaling to the UI thread if required. public void AppendOutput(string text) Parameters text string The text to append to the output. Dispose(bool) Disposes of the resources (other than memory) used by the Form. protected override void Dispose(bool disposing) Parameters disposing bool true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources. EvaluateExpression(string) Evaluates a mathematical expression that may contain variables and operators. This method replaces variables with their values, then evaluates the expression. Supports addition, subtraction, and multiplication. public object EvaluateExpression(string expression) Parameters expression string The expression string to evaluate. Returns object The result as either an integer or double. ProcessArrayDeclaration(string) Processes array declarations in the format array type name size. Creates a new array with the specified element type, name, and size, initialized with default values. Supported element types are int and real. public void ProcessArrayDeclaration(string commandLine) Parameters commandLine string The array declaration command line. Examples array int nums 10 // Creates an integer array named nums with 10 elements array real prices 5 // Creates a real number array named prices with 5 elements ProcessAssignment(string) Handles assignment statements of the form name = expression by evaluating the right-hand side and storing the result in the variables dictionary. public void ProcessAssignment(string commandLine) Parameters commandLine string The assignment command line to process. ProcessIntDeclaration(string) Handles integer variable declarations, optionally including an initializer expression. Supports declarations such as int x and int x = 5 + y. public void ProcessIntDeclaration(string commandLine) Parameters commandLine string The full integer declaration command line. ProcessPeek(string) Processes PEEK commands to retrieve values from array elements into variables. Supports two formats: "peek variable = arrayName[index]" or "peek variable = arrayName index". The retrieved value is stored in the specified variable. public void ProcessPeek(string commandLine) Parameters commandLine string The PEEK command line to process. Examples peek x = nums[5] // Retrieves value from nums[5] into variable x peek y = prices 5 // Retrieves value from prices[5] into variable y ProcessPoke(string) Processes POKE commands to store values into array elements. Supports two formats: "poke arrayName[index] = value" or "poke arrayName index = value". The value is automatically converted to match the array's declared type. public void ProcessPoke(string commandLine) Parameters commandLine string The POKE command line to process. Examples poke nums[5] = 99 // Stores 99 at index 5 of nums array poke prices 5 = 99.99 // Stores 99.99 at index 5 of prices array ProcessRealDeclaration(string) Handles real (floating-point) variable declarations, optionally including an initializer expression. Supports declarations such as real r and real r = a / 2.5. public void ProcessRealDeclaration(string commandLine) Parameters commandLine string The full real number declaration command line.

api/api/BOOSEapp.MethodInfo.html.title: Class MethodInfo | BOOSEapp Documentation
api/api/BOOSEapp.MethodInfo.html.summary: Class MethodInfo Namespace BOOSEapp Assembly BOOSEapp.dll Represents a method definition, including its name, parameters, body, and return variable. public class MethodInfo Inheritance object MethodInfo Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors MethodInfo() Initializes a new instance of the MethodInfo class with empty parameter and body lists. public MethodInfo() Properties Body Gets or sets the list of command lines that form the method body. public List<string> Body { get; set; } Property Value List<string> Name Gets or sets the name of the method. public string Name { get; set; } Property Value string Parameters Gets or sets the list of parameter names for the method. public List<string> Parameters { get; set; } Property Value List<string> ReturnVariable Gets or sets the name of the return variable, which should match the method name. public string ReturnVariable { get; set; } Property Value string

api/api/BOOSEapp.ResetCommand.html.summary: Class ResetCommand Namespace BOOSEapp Assembly BOOSEapp.dll Represents a command that resets the canvas state, including the pen position. public class ResetCommand : ICommand Inheritance object ResetCommand Implements ICommand Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods Execute(ICanvas) Executes the command by resetting the specified canvas pen position to the origin. public void Execute(ICanvas canvas) Parameters canvas ICanvas The canvas to reset.

api/api/BOOSEapp.SetPenColorCommand.html.title: Class SetPenColorCommand | BOOSEapp Documentation
api/api/BOOSEapp.SetPenColorCommand.html.summary: Class SetPenColorCommand Namespace BOOSEapp Assembly BOOSEapp.dll Represents a command that sets the current pen color on the canvas using RGB components. public class SetPenColorCommand : ICommand Inheritance object SetPenColorCommand Implements ICommand Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) Constructors SetPenColorCommand(int, int, int) Initializes a new instance of the SetPenColorCommand class with the specified RGB components. public SetPenColorCommand(int r, int g, int b) Parameters r int The red component of the color (0–255). g int The green component of the color (0–255). b int The blue component of the color (0–255). Exceptions ArgumentException Thrown when r, g, or b is outside the range 0–255. Methods Execute(ICanvas) Executes the command by setting the pen color of the specified canvas. public void Execute(ICanvas canvas) Parameters canvas ICanvas The canvas on which to set the pen color. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when canvas is null. ToString() Returns a string that represents the current pen color command. public override string ToString() Returns string A string that describes the RGB components of the pen color.

api/api/BOOSEapp.WriteTextCommand.html.title: Class WriteTextCommand | BOOSEapp Documentation
api/api/BOOSEapp.WriteTextCommand.html.summary: Class WriteTextCommand Namespace BOOSEapp Assembly BOOSEapp.dll Represents a command that writes text onto the canvas at the current pen position. public class WriteTextCommand : ICommand Inheritance object WriteTextCommand Implements ICommand Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors WriteTextCommand(string) Initializes a new instance of the WriteTextCommand class with the specified text. public WriteTextCommand(string text) Parameters text string The text to write to the canvas. Exceptions ArgumentNullException Thrown when text is null. Methods Execute(ICanvas) Executes the command by writing the configured text onto the specified canvas. public void Execute(ICanvas canvas) Parameters canvas ICanvas The canvas on which to write the text.

api/api/BOOSEapp.html.title: Namespace BOOSEapp | BOOSEapp Documentation
api/api/BOOSEapp.html.summary: Namespace BOOSEapp Classes AppArray Represents a command that handles array creation requests, such as array int scores 10, within the BOOSE application. AppCanvas Represents a drawing surface that implements the ICanvas interface. Provides methods for drawing shapes, lines, and text. AppCircle Represents a command that draws a circle on a canvas. AppCommandFactory Provides a singleton factory for creating ICommand instances from text input. AppDrawTo Represents a command that draws a line from the current canvas position to the specified coordinates. AppFor Represents a command that handles parsing and reporting of FOR loop constructs. AppIf Represents a command that handles parsing and reporting of IF statement constructs. AppInt Represents a command that declares integer variables in the application context. AppMethod Represents a command that handles parsing and reporting of method definitions. AppMoveTo Represents a command that moves the pen to the specified coordinates on the canvas. AppParser Provides functionality to parse text lines into command objects using a command factory. AppReal Represents a command that declares real (floating-point) variables in the application context. AppRectangle Represents a command that draws a rectangle on the canvas using the specified dimensions. AppWhile Represents a command that handles parsing and reporting of WHILE loop constructs. CanvasException Represents errors that occur during canvas-related operations. ClearCommand Represents a command that clears the drawing canvas. MainForm Main form for the BOOSE Drawing Application. This form provides the user interface for entering drawing commands, executing them, and viewing the results on a drawing canvas. MethodInfo Represents a method definition, including its name, parameters, body, and return variable. ResetCommand Represents a command that resets the canvas state, including the pen position. SetPenColorCommand Represents a command that sets the current pen color on the canvas using RGB components. WriteTextCommand Represents a command that writes text onto the canvas at the current pen position. Interfaces ICanvas Defines a contract for drawing operations on a canvas. ICommand Defines a command in the drawing program that follows the Command pattern to encapsulate a drawing operation. ICommandParser Defines a contract for parsing textual commands into executable command objects.

docs/getting-started.html.title: Getting Started | BOOSEapp Documentation
docs/getting-started.html.summary: Getting Started This page contains sample BOOSE programs that demonstrate drawing, variables, arrays, conditions, loops, and methods. Each example is labelled as restricted (works with the default classes) or unrestricted (requires you to replace the corresponding class, such as Int, Real, Array, If, While, For, or Method). Running BOOSEapp in Visual Studio Code To run BOOSEapp from VS Code: Open the BOOSEapp project folder in Visual Studio Code. Make sure the C# extension is installed so VS Code recognises the project. When VS Code prompts you to create a launch configuration for the project, accept it (or choose Run > Run Without Debugging once so it creates one automatically). Open any C# file from the BOOSEapp project so VS Code knows which project to run. Press Ctrl+F5 or choose Run > Run Without Debugging. When the BOOSEapp window opens, paste one of the example programs from this page into the editor area and run it there. Getting Started This page contains sample BOOSE programs that demonstrate drawing, variables, arrays, conditions, loops, and methods. Each example is labelled as restricted or unrestricted in the comments. 1. Basic drawing restricted: *demonstrate BOOSE working with no commands that violate restrictions moveto 100,100 pen 0,255,0 circle 50 pen 255,0,0 moveto 150,50 rect 50,100 2. basic drawing unrestricted: *to run this program you will need to replace several drawing methods and facilities. moveto 100,150 pen 0,0,255 circle 150 pen 255,0,0 moveto 150,50 rect 150,100 moveto 150,200 pen 0,0,255 circle 250 pen 255,0,0 moveto 200,250 rect 200,100 3. restricted int *use of variables that won't violate restrictions int radius = 50 int width width = 2*radius int height = 100 int colour = 255 pen colour,0,0 moveto 100, 100 circle radius pen 0,colour,0 rect width, height 4. unrestricted int *use of variables that will violate restrictions, need to replace int class to get this to run int radius = 50 int width int number width = 2*radius int height = 100 int red = 255 int green = 128 pen red,0,0 moveto 100, 100 circle radius rect width, height pen red,0,0 moveto 150, 150 circle radius 5. restricted reals *demonstrate use of real values with no restriction violations pen 0,0,255 real length = 15.5 real width = 10.0 write length * width 6. unrestricted reals *demonstrate use of real values which violates restrictions. You will need to replace the Real class to get this working pen 0,0,255 real length = 15.5 real width = 10.0 real pi = 3.14159 real radius = 27.7 real circ = 2 * pi * radius real another real more moveto 100,100 write length * width moveto 100,125 write circ circle circ 7. restricted array *int and real arrays; second half needs Array replacement int x = 0 real y array int nums 10 poke nums 5 = 99 peek x = nums 5 circle x array real prices 10 poke prices 5 = 99.99 peek y = prices 5 write "�"+y int x = 0 real y real z array int nums 10 poke nums 5 = 99 peek x = nums 5 circle x array real prices 10 poke prices 5 = 99.99 peek y = prices 5 pen 0,255,0 write "�"+y array real logs 10 poke logs 5 = 100.001 peek z = logs 5 moveto 0,25 write z 8. unrestricted array *unrestricted array example, you will need to replace the Array class to get this to run. int x real y real z array int nums 10 array real prices 10 array real logs 10 poke nums 5 = 99 peek x = nums 5 circle x pen 0,255,0 poke prices 5 = 99.99 peek y = prices 5 write "�"+y array real logs 10 poke logs 5 = 100.01 peek z = log 5 moveto 0,25 write z 9. restricted ifs *example of an if statement which won't violate restrictions *change the value of control to see the circle change size int control = 50 if control < 10 pen 255,0,0 circle 20 else pen 0,255,0 circle 100 end if 10. unrestricted ifs *example of an if statement which will violate restrictions, you will need to replace the If class. *change the value of control to see the circle change size int control = 50 if control < 10 if control < 5 pen 255,0,0 else pen 0,0,255 end if circle 20 rect 20,20 else pen 0,255,0 circle 100 rect 100,100 end if 11. restricted while *example of a while statement which won't violate restrictions moveto 100,100 int width = 9 int height = 100 pen 255,128,0 while height > 50 circle height height = height - 15 end while pen 0,255,0 moveto 25,25 rect 100,100 12. unrestricted while *example of a while statement which will violate restrictions, you will need to replace the While class. moveto 100,100 int width = 9 int height = 150 pen 255,128,128 while height > 50 circle height height = height - 15 if height < 100 pen 0,128,255 end if end while pen 0,255,0 moveto 50,50 height = 50 while height > 10 rect height, height height = height - 10 end while 13. restricted for *example of a for statement which won't violate restrictions pen 255,0,0 moveto 100,100 for count = 1 to 10 step 2 circle count * 10 end for 14. unrestricted for *example of a for statement which will violate restrictions, you will need to replace the For class. pen 255,0,0 moveto 200,200 for count = 1 to 20 step 2 circle count * 10 end for pen 0,255,0 moveto 150,150 for count = 20 to 1 step -2 circle count * 10 end for pen 0,0,255 for count2 = 30 to 10 step -1 circle count2 * 20 end for 15. restricted method method int mulMethod int one, int two mulMethod = one * two end method method int divMethod int one, int two divMethod = one / two end method int global = 55 call mullMethod 10 5 moveto 100,100 write mullMethod call mullMethod 10 5 moveto 100,200 write divMethod 16. unrestricted method method int testMethod int one, int two testMethod = one * two end method int global = 55 call testMethod 10 15 moveto 200,200 write testMethod circle testMethod rect global, global method int mulMethod int one, int two mulMethod = one * two end method method int divMethod int one, int two divMethod = one / two end method int global = 55 call mullMethod 10 5 moveto 100,100 write mullMethod call divMethod 10 5 moveto 100,200 write divMethod

docs/introduction.html.title: Introduction | BOOSEapp Documentation
docs/introduction.html.summary: Introduction BOOSEapp is a small drawing and scripting environment where you control a canvas using simple text commands. It is designed to demonstrate variables, control flow, arrays, and methods through visual output on a canvas. BOOSE scripts are parsed into command objects (like AppMoveTo, AppDrawTo, AppCircle, AppRectangle) and executed on the AppCanvas surface. Commands implement the ICommand interface and are created by the AppCommandFactory and AppParser components. What you can learn Basic drawing with moveto, drawto, circle, and rect. Using integer and real variables (int, real) to control shape size and colour. Creating arrays and reading/writing values with poke and peek. Writing conditional logic with if / else and loops with while and for. Defining reusable methods and calling them from your scripts. Where to start Read the Getting Started page for a full set of example programs you can paste directly into BOOSEapp. Open the homepage to navigate the rest of the documentation and API reference.

index.html.title: This is the HOMEPAGE. | BOOSEapp Documentation
index.html.summary: This is the HOMEPAGE. Refer to Markdown for how to write markdown files. BOOSEapp Documentation BOOSEapp is a drawing and scripting application that lets you control a canvas with simple commands and loops. Get started Getting Started Introduction What you can do Move the pen around the canvas with commands like moveto and drawto (AppMoveTo, AppDrawTo). Draw shapes such as circles and rectangles (AppCircle, AppRectangle). Change pen colour, clear or reset the canvas, and write text (SetPenColorCommand, ClearCommand, ResetCommand, WriteTextCommand). Use variables, loops, and conditions to create reusable drawing scripts (AppInt, AppReal, AppFor, AppWhile, AppIf, AppMethod). Explore the API BOOSEapp namespace Key types: Drawing surface: AppCanvas, CanvasException. Commands: ICommand, AppCommandFactory, ICommandParser, AppParser. User interface: MainForm.
